raw_data.label: cor-pipeline-continuity-margin-stability
raw_data.label_text: Corollary: Pipeline Continuity Under Margin-Based Status Stability
raw_data.name: Pipeline Continuity Under Margin-Based Status Stability
raw_data.statement: Assume the **Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability**. Then for all inputs $(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{d1})$ and $(\mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d2})$, the deterministic bound $F_{\text{pot,det}}$ in the Deterministic Continuity theorem satisfies: $F_{\text{pot,det}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d1}, \mathbf{v}_{d2}) \;\xrightarrow[(d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2),\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_r\|,\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_d\|)\to 0]{}\;0$. Moreover, for $d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2)^2\le r_{\mathrm{status}}$ we have $n_c=0$ and the unstable term vanishes exactly; the remaining terms are controlled by the deterministic continuity of the patched standardization operator and the Lipschitz continuity of the potential map $F$.
raw_data.full_statement_text:
Assume the **Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability** ([](#def-axiom-margin-stability)). Then for all inputs $(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{d1})$ and $(\mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d2})$, the deterministic bound $F_{\text{pot,det}}$ in [](#thm-deterministic-potential-continuity) satisfies
$$

F_{\text{pot,det}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2, \mathbf{v}_{r1}, \mathbf{v}_{r2}, \mathbf{v}_{d1}, \mathbf{v}_{d2})
\;\xrightarrow[(d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2),\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_r\|,\,\|\Delta\mathbf{v}_d\|)\to 0]{}\;0.

$$
Moreover, for $d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}_1,\mathcal{S}_2)^2\le r_{\mathrm{status}}$ we have $n_c=0$ and the unstable term vanishes exactly; the remaining terms are controlled by the deterministic continuity of the patched standardization operator and the Lipschitz continuity of the potential map $F$.
raw_data.proof_sketch: This corollary follows directly from the theorem by invoking the Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability, which guarantees that status changes are bounded when swarm displacement is small. Under this axiom, when displacement is within the margin radius, the number of status changes $n_c=0$, eliminating the unstable term. The remaining stable term vanishes continuously as the inputs converge.
relations_established: For d_Disp^2 <= r_status: unstable term vanishes (n_c = 0)
Under Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability, deterministic bound F_pot,det -> 0 as inputs converge

raw_data.label: cor-chain-rule-sigma-reg-var
raw_data.label_text: Corollary: Chain‑rule bound for σ'_reg ∘ Var
raw_data.name: Chain‑rule bound for σ'_reg ∘ Var
raw_data.statement:
Under the conditions of the lemma and §8.2.2.9, the composite map σ'_{text{reg}}∘Var is Lipschitz with
$$
L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}\circ\mathrm{Var}}\;\le\; L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}}\,\Big( L_{m_2,M}+2 V_{\max} L_{\mu,M}\Big).
$$
In particular, for the empirical aggregator of §6.2.2.a (see lem-empirical-aggregator-properties), $L_{\mu,M}=1/\sqrt{k}$ and $L_{m_2,M}=2V_{\max}/\sqrt{k}$, hence
$$
L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}\circ\mathrm{Var}}\;\le\; L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}}\,\Big( \tfrac{2 V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}} + 2 V_{\max}\,\tfrac{1}{\sqrt{k}}\Big)
\;=\; \frac{2 L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}} V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}}.
$$
raw_data.full_statement_text:
Under the conditions of the lemma and §8.2.2.9, the composite map σ'_{text{reg}}∘Var is Lipschitz with
$$
L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}\circ\mathrm{Var}}\;\le\; L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}}\,\Big( L_{m_2,M}+2 V_{\max} L_{\mu,M}\Big).
$$
In particular, for the empirical aggregator of §6.2.2.a (see lem-empirical-aggregator-properties), $L_{\mu,M}=1/\sqrt{k}$ and $L_{m_2,M}=2V_{\max}/\sqrt{k}$, hence
$$
L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}\circ\mathrm{Var}}\;\le\; L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}}\,\Big( \tfrac{2 V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}} + 2 V_{\max}\,\tfrac{1}{\sqrt{k}}\Big)
\;=\; \frac{2 L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}} V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}}.
$$
relations_established: Provides Lipschitz bound for composite map sigma'_reg o Var
Chain rule bound: L_{sigma'_reg o Var} <= L_{sigma'_reg}(L_{m2,M} + 2V_max*L_{mu,M})

raw_data.label: cor-closed-form-lipschitz-composite
raw_data.label_text: Corollary: Closed‑form bound for L_{g_A∘z} (empirical aggregator)
raw_data.name: Closed‑form bound for L_{g_A∘z} (empirical aggregator)
raw_data.statement:
Let $k=|\mathcal A(\mathcal S)|$ and assume $|v_i|\le V_{\max}$. For the empirical aggregator of §6.2.2.a (see lem-empirical-aggregator-properties) with the regularized standardization and piecewise rescale of §8.2.2, the composite map $g_A\circ z$ is globally Lipschitz with
$$
\boxed{\;L_{g_A\circ z}\;\le\; \max\{\,L_P,\,1\,\}\;\cdot\; \frac{2 L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}} V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}}\;}
$$
where $L_P=\|P'\|_\infty$ is the uniform derivative bound of the cubic patch from §8.2.2.5.
raw_data.full_statement_text:
Let $k=|\mathcal A(\mathcal S)|$ and assume $|v_i|\le V_{\max}$. For the empirical aggregator of §6.2.2.a (see lem-empirical-aggregator-properties) with the regularized standardization and piecewise rescale of §8.2.2, the composite map $g_A\circ z$ is globally Lipschitz with
$$
\boxed{\;L_{g_A\circ z}\;\le\; \max\{\,L_P,\,1\,\}\;\cdot\; \frac{2 L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}} V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}}\;}
$$
where $L_P=\|P'\|_\infty$ is the uniform derivative bound of the cubic patch from §8.2.2.5.
relations_established: Establishes global Lipschitz bound for composite map g_A o z
